intro: Filipendula stepposa, commonly known as steppe meadow sweet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the steppes of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly serrated edge. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers in late summer, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Filipendula stepposa thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, open habitats.
